cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the western Atlantic; expected to turn northwest late Wednesday and approach the South-/North-Carolina coast Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina or southern North Carolina near Cape Fear

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coast from Georgia northward through South Carolina and North Carolina to the Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Low (≈26%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Thursday into Friday; gusts expected to remain below hurricane strength.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Georgia coast if the track shifts southwest.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain Thursday night through Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents affecting approach channels and pilot boarding areas.
